The Hawks were 6-2 in conference play and were [[Big Ten Conference|Big Ten]] co-champions. Iowa went to the [[Rose Bowl Game|Rose Bowl]] for the first time in 23 years. Their previous appearance was following the [[1958 college football season|1958]] season, when Iowa won the [[1959 Rose Bowl]], 38-12. In that game Iowa crushed the [[California Golden Bears football|California Golden Bears]], led by [[Quarterback|QB]] [[Joe Kapp]]. This time Iowa had a more difficult time, shutout by [[Don James (American football)|Don James']] [[Washington Huskies football|Washington Huskies]] 28-0, and the Hawkeyes finished the '81 season at
